nodes.bodyText: One optimization I just thought of, now that we are splitting unit and int tests into separate jobs, is that only the int test job needs mysql.  Can this step be done on per-job basis?  (Can be follow up PR.)
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -13,12 +13,25 @@ cache:
 addons:
   apt:
     packages:
-      - oracle-java8-installer
-      - oracle-java8-unlimited-jce-policy
+      #- oracle-java8-installer
+      #- oracle-java8-unlimited-jce-policy
+services:
+  - mysql
+before_install:
+  - mysql --version
+  - wget https://repo.mysql.com//mysql-apt-config_0.8.10-1_all.deb
+  - sudo dpkg -i mysql-apt-config_0.8.10-1_all.deb
+  - sudo apt-get update -q
+  - sudo apt-get install -q -y --allow-unauthenticated -o Dpkg::Options::=--force-confnew mysql-server
+  - sudo systemctl restart mysql
+  - sudo mysql_upgrade
+  - mysql --version
+  - mysql -e 'CREATE DATABASE AccountMetadata;'
+  - mysql -e 'USE AccountMetadata; SOURCE ./ambry-account/src/main/resources/AccountSchema.ddl;'

nodes.bodyText:
I think that may be possible, although I can't find documentation that explicitly says that you can change the services. However, I did find instructions for changing other parameters per each job: https://docs.travis-ci.com/user/build-matrix/#using-different-programming-languages-per-job
So, maybe moving services and before_install to the int test job will work:
jobs:
  include:
    - stage: test
      name: "Unit Tests"
      script: ./travis-unit-test.sh
    - stage: test
      name: "Integration Tests"
      script: ./travis-int-test.sh
      services:
        - mysql
      before_install:
        ...
    - stage: publish
      name: "Publish To Bintray"
      script: ./travis-publish.sh

+  - sudo dpkg -i mysql-apt-config_0.8.10-1_all.deb
+  - sudo apt-get update -q

nodes.bodyText: @Arun-LinkedIn I ran into collation errors when I ran the script on local Mysql db.  I couldn't find much info on utf8-bin,   Can we go with default collation for the char set?

Seems like default collation for char set uf8 (utf8_general_ci) is case-insensitive and hence complains of unique key violation for case insensitive duplicate account or container names. This is differing from our code logic which seems to do case-sensitive comparison. May be we can update our code logic if there are no existing case insensitive duplicates in PROD? EI has one such case - two accounts with names 'MayFlower' and 'mayflower'.
Since EI has such case, we probably need to maintain the case-sensitive comparison.

Running the script on local mysql instance throws the following error:
ERROR 1273 (HY000): Unknown collation: 'utf8'
I'm not sure why it works on EI but we need an option that works consistently.
@Arun-LinkedIn Added the sleep after the assertion failed.  Thread removal may not be immediate.

For cases where a poll with timeout is needed, we have a test utility that can be used:
TestUtils.checkAndSleep(0, () -> numThreadsByThisName(MySqlAccountService.MYSQL_ACCOUNT_UPDATER_PREFIX), 200);
Good point.  I'll change that in a follow up PR.
@justinlin-linkedin The test passes consistently (so far) with this sleep added. This is a temp fix.  A better one is to enhance the afterTest() to check the metrics repeatedly up to a timeout.
Added the changes to NettyByteBufLeakHelper.afterTest() in this PR.
Note: added because modified line in MockStorageManager hits a compile error in JDK11 trying to access package private class Disk.
nit: [optional]  probably move this method to somewhere after public methods.
should this be in the integration-test directory instead of the test directory?
Definitely.  My next PR will add more tests here so I'll also move the class.
